intro: Chamaeiris orientalis, commonly known as the oriental sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features slender stems and small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Chamaeiris orientalis thrives in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
